docs.lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Banks, men's clothing designer, sat in a threadbare office in the B. Glanzrock clothing factory on lower Fifth Avenue. He is a broad-shouldered young man (40 regular), with a bit of a paunch, a cherubic face and quizzical eyes. Despite the pressures of his work, he is ordinarily serene, with a good laugh.
